org.foxlabs.validation.message

Class DefaultMessageBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.foxlabs.validation.message.AbstractMessageBuilder
      • org.foxlabs.validation.message.DefaultMessageBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MessageBuilder

    public class DefaultMessageBuilder
extends AbstractMessageBuilder
    This class provides default MessageBuilder implementation.

    The following rules are applied to error message templates:

    • The \ character is considered as escape character.
    • The string enclosed into {} characters is considered as optional argument.
    • If value of optional argument is null then it will be replaced with empty string; if value is not defined then no replacement will occur.
    • The string enclosed into <> characters is considered as required argument.
    • If value of required argument is not defined or null then whole template will be rendered as null.
    • The string enclosed into () characters is considered as subtemplate.
    • If subtemplate is null then it will be replaced with empty string.
    • Argument names must not contain \{}<>() characters.
    Author:
    Fox Mulder

      • renderComponents

        protected String renderComponents(Validation<?>[] components,
                                  ValidationContext<?> context)
        Renders the specified array of validation components. This method concatenates error messages of the specified validation components and may return null if there are no messages available.
        Parameters:
        components - Array of validation components to be rendered.
        context - Validation context.
        Returns:
        Error messages of the specified validation components.
